passage_text: Verizon's Share Everything family data plan is getting a little more affordable. Verizon's Share Everything plans add a new option Verizon. The carrier said that starting Tuesday, Verizon customers will be able to sign up for a $60 Share Everything plan, $20 less than the current cheapest plan. Customers will only get half as much data -- 250 megabytes vs. the $80, 500 MB plan.

In addition to pricing changes, Verizon also added new data tiers — 6GB, 12GB, 14GB, and 16GB — and extended its Verizon Edge discounts to the 6GB level. The Edge plan allows users to pay for their phones over 24 months instead of upfront, and discounts the monthly Verizon Access fee.

In another sign that competition is bringing down wireless bills, Verizon on Wednesday cut most of its data plan costs by $10. A plan with one gigabyte of shared data will now start at $30 per month instead of $40, two gigabytes will start at $40 instead of $50, and so on.
